answers.answer: Dear Patty:A painful neuropathy of the hands and feet is seen mainly in systemic diseases such as alcoholism.  A numbness with a pain component can be seen in diabetes.  But a strict hands and foot distribution is unusual in most of the other types of neuropathy from a genetic and metabolic etiology.  A viral illness can cause a neuropathy but not in a hands and foot distribution.  There may be an arm or leg for instance but not the distal extremities.CCF Neuro MD

I have one more question for you.  For the people who have unknown etiology, what do neurologists think are the causes for all of these cases that fall into that category or is that still a total mystery at this point?
